condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 Increased capacity of public schools teachers and education personnel to deliver child-centered and flexible pedagogy in inclusive environments.

description.narrative: UNICEF supports the Ministry of Education and several Education Sector partners to improve the quality of learning environments, both in formal or non-formal settings, through holistic trainings, coaching, piloting innovative programming, or monitoring teacher performance in learning spaces/public schools. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Output Indicator 2.2.b: % of trained teachers who have acquired the competencies targeted in each training module (measured by achieving 70% of the total and disaggregated by type of personnel, gender, shift, ALP and training module) [% of UNICEF-trained teachers whose teaching performance meets national performance standards]
2.2.1 - An assessment is available, of the impact of TTCM-trained teachers on the learning outcomes of children enrolled in MEHE public schools

actual.value: 2020:reporting will be done at the end of the year

title.narrative: 2.2.6 - # of boys and girls assisted through CP case management and specialized services

% of enrolled girls and boys who attend at least 70% of the round and sit for the summative assesment (CB-ECE, BLN, ABLN, and ALP)[previously % of girls and boys registered in regulated NFE and the Retention Support Programme who have completed the programme]
2.2.7 - % of boys and girls with disabilities and learning difficulties enrolled in the inclusive pilot schools

2.2.4 - % of girls and boys who transition to another learning opportunity upon completion of an NFE programme (CB-ECE, BLN and ALP) [% of girls and boys who acquire the learning objectives of a regulated NFE programme on completion of the round (CB-ECE, BLN, and ALP)]
2.2.2 - Analysis document available, of the impact of DOPS academic monitoring visits on the learning of children
2.2.5 - % of girls and boys who transition to FE upon completion of an NFE programme (CB-ECE, BLN, ALP)

target.value: 2020:cbece to FE 100% BLN to ALP: 50% ABLN to BLN: 20% BLN to Youth: 25% ABLN to Youth: 10%

title.narrative: 2.2.6 - # of cases of school based, family, or community based violence identified within school settings reported through DOPS Central, % of which were closed
# of CERD trainers trained on the advanced trainer curriculum, gender and Inclusion
Dropout rates per grade (disaggregated by gender) of non-Lebanese children enrolled in Lebanese public schools
# of Teachers and public schools personnel provided with training on TTCM core modules as applicable
% of boys and girls using the Akelius platform whose overall performance has improved by two points (attendance, results for transition)
% of second shift schools achieving 70% completion rate
# of NFE educators and facilitators trained on NFE programmes package content (CB-ECE, BLN and YBLN) and TTCM core modules
Exam passing rate per grade of non-Lebanese children enrolled in Lebanese public schools
# of teachers and staff trained on the Akelius platform
% of DOPS counselors who have acquired the competencies targeted in the training module (measured by achieving 70% of the total)
% of non-Lebanese students who have completed the 19/20 scholastic year in Lebanese public schools (disaggregated by gender)
